snippet: Councilman Ras Baraka, the son of a militant poet, held off a late surge from a newcomer, Shavar Jeffries, to win the election, heralding a shift in New Jersey’s largest city.
abstract: Councilman Ras Baraka is elected mayor of Newark; election result heralds shift in the direction that New Jersey's largest city has embarked upon for most of the last decade; Baraka defeated Shavar Jeffries in a bitter contest that was in many ways a referendum on former Mayor Cory A Booker's reformist policies.

byline.original: By DAVID W. CHEN and KATE ZERNIKE
byline.contributor: Derrick Nunnally and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Councilman Ras Baraka, the son of a militant poet, held off a late surge from a newcomer, Shavar Jeffries, to win the election, heralding a shift in New Jersey’s largest city.

headline.main: Newark’s Voters Choose New Mayor and New Path
headline.print_headline: Newark’s Voters Choose New Mayor and New Path
